intro.title: Welcome to Los Angeles
intro.description: You've been hired as GM of the Los Angeles Lakers. LeBron James is 41 but still elite. Anthony Davis anchors the defense. The franchise expects nothing less than a championship. Your current payroll is $138M—already over the $136M cap. Every move matters.
intro.context: The Lakers' championship window is closing. LeBron's contract expires next year. Do you mortgage the future for one more ring, or start planning the post-LeBron era?

rounds.title: Opening Day Decision
rounds.description: Training camp begins. Your front office presents three paths to improve the roster. The pressure from ownership is immense—they want another banner.

choices.title: Sign a Star
choices.description: Paul George is available! The former All-Star would give you a lethal Big 3. But at $42M, you're deep into luxury tax territory.
choices.consequence: Your payroll explodes to $180M. Ownership grumbles but approves—they want a ring.

choices.title: Add Veteran Depth
choices.description: Marcus Smart brings championship experience and elite defense. At $14.5M, it's a smart investment that keeps tax manageable.
choices.consequence: Smart immediately becomes a locker room leader. The defense improves noticeably.

choices.title: Develop Young Talent
choices.description: Invest in Dalton Knecht and Bronny James. They're already on rookie deals—just give them more minutes and development focus.
choices.consequence: Knecht starts hitting threes. The future looks brighter, but is it enough for now?

rounds.title: Luxury Tax Crisis
rounds.description: The Big 3 is dominant, but your $180M payroll has triggered massive luxury tax. Ownership demands you find savings.

choices.title: Trade D'Angelo Russell
choices.description: Russell's $19M comes off the books. You lose some playmaking but gain financial relief.
choices.consequence: The trade goes through. Your rotation is thinner but the tax bill shrinks.

choices.title: Keep the Core Together
choices.description: Convince ownership this is a championship roster. Pay the tax and compete.
choices.consequence: Ownership reluctantly agrees. The team chemistry improves with continuity.

choices.title: Hire Elite Assistant Coach
choices.description: Bring in a defensive specialist. No salary cap impact but costs $2M against budget.
choices.consequence: The defense transforms. Your Big 3 can focus on offense.

rounds.title: Mid-Season Opportunity
rounds.description: You're competitive but need another piece. A trade opportunity arises—DeMar DeRozan is available.

choices.title: Acquire DeRozan
choices.description: DeRozan's mid-range game would be lethal alongside LeBron. At $25M, the tax hit is significant.
choices.consequence: DeRozan-LeBron pick and roll is unstoppable. The tax bill grows.

choices.title: Add Malik Monk
choices.description: Monk provides instant offense off the bench. At $12M, it's a reasonable addition.
choices.consequence: Monk's microwave scoring stabilizes the bench unit.

choices.title: Promote from Within
choices.description: Give Dalton Knecht a bigger role. He's ready to contribute more.
choices.consequence: Knecht exceeds expectations. The rookie shines under pressure.

rounds.title: Rookie Development Progress
rounds.description: The young players are improving but the team is struggling. You need to decide how to proceed.

choices.title: Make a Splash Signing
choices.description: Jimmy Butler becomes available! His playoff experience could push you over the top.
choices.consequence: Butler's intensity transforms the team. But the budget is stretched thin.

choices.title: Add Proven Veterans
choices.description: Bruce Brown brings playoff experience and versatility at $11M.
choices.consequence: Brown's defense and hustle provides stability.

choices.title: Trust the Process
choices.description: Keep developing the young core. Bronny and Knecht are growing weekly.
choices.consequence: The young players continue to improve. It's a marathon, not a sprint.

rounds.title: All-In for the Championship
rounds.description: Your star-studded roster is dominant but expensive. The All-Star break approaches.

choices.title: Sign Buyout Market Player
choices.description: Chris Paul is bought out and wants to compete for a ring. Minimum salary.
choices.consequence: CP3's leadership and playmaking adds another dimension.

choices.title: Load Management
choices.description: Rest your stars for the playoffs. Accept fewer regular season wins.
choices.consequence: The stars are fresh for the playoffs. Regular season record suffers slightly.

choices.title: Push for Home Court
choices.description: Maximize minutes for your stars. Chase the 1-seed.
choices.consequence: The team surges in the standings but fatigue becomes a concern.

rounds.title: Finding Balance
rounds.description: Your roster is competitive and your finances are manageable. Time to fine-tune.

choices.title: Make a Minor Upgrade
choices.description: Bogdan Bogdanović is available. His shooting would help.
choices.consequence: Bogdanović immediately helps spacing.

choices.title: Play the Young Guys
choices.description: Give more minutes to Knecht and the young players.
choices.consequence: The young players gain valuable experience.

choices.title: Stand Pat
choices.description: The roster is good enough. Focus on chemistry and health.
choices.consequence: The team gels together. Chemistry improves.

rounds.title: The Rebuild Question
rounds.description: Your young core is developing but the team is bubble territory. A crossroads decision.

choices.title: Pivot to Win-Now
choices.description: Bradley Beal is available at a reduced salary. One last push with LeBron.
choices.consequence: Beal joins the Lakers. It's all-in time.

choices.title: Add Reasonable Depth
choices.description: Sign some veterans on team-friendly deals.
choices.consequence: Experienced veterans stabilize the rotation.

choices.title: Fully Commit to Youth
choices.description: This is a development year. Build for the future.
choices.consequence: The young players thrive with increased responsibility.

rounds.title: Playoff Push
rounds.description: The playoff race heats up. Your championship-caliber roster is ready. Final adjustments needed.

choices.title: Add Insurance Piece
choices.description: Sign a veteran minimum player as playoff insurance.
choices.consequence: Extra depth for the playoff run.

choices.title: Focus on Chemistry
choices.description: No more moves. Let the team gel.
choices.consequence: The team's chemistry reaches its peak.

rounds.title: Closing Stretch
rounds.description: Your balanced approach has the Lakers in playoff position. Final push time.

choices.title: Small Upgrade
choices.description: Add a minimum salary player for depth.
choices.consequence: Extra bodies for the stretch run.

choices.title: Trust Your Roster
choices.description: The roster is set. Focus on execution.
choices.consequence: The team executes down the stretch.

rounds.title: Play-In Push
rounds.description: Your young team is fighting for a play-in spot. Every game matters.

choices.title: Add Veteran Leadership
choices.description: Sign a veteran minimum player to mentor the young guys.
choices.consequence: The veteran's presence steadies the young roster.

choices.title: Ride or Die with Youth
choices.description: The young players got you here. Trust them.
choices.consequence: The young players rise to the occasion.

intro.context: The Bucks have the superstar. They have the second star. But the supporting cast and depth need work. Can you build a championship roster without breaking the bank?

intro.context: The Spurs' rebuild is ahead of schedule thanks to Wembanyama. With cap space to spare, you can chase stars now or continue developing the young core for sustained success.

choices.title: Accelerate the Timeline
